content:
Taking the car ferry from Harwich, UK to the Hook of Holland is a great way to shorten the driving distance to Amsterdam. Here's the revised itinerary, considering your ferry trip and the return via the Eurotunnel. I've also included the total mileage for your journey.

Outbound Trip:

Day 1 (April 3): London to Harwich

* Distance: 90 miles / 145 km
* Driving time: 2 hours

Day 2 (April 4): Hook of Holland to Amsterdam

* Distance: 57 miles / 92 km
* Driving time: 1.5 hours

Days 3-11: Same as previously suggested (Amsterdam to Nice, including Lake Como).

Total distance for the outbound trip (including London to Harwich): 1,087 miles / 1,749 km

Return Trip:

Days 12-16: Same as previously suggested (Nice to Calais).

Day 17 (April 16): Calais to London (via Eurotunnel)

* Distance: 108 miles / 174 km
* Driving time: 2 hours (excluding Eurotunnel crossing time)

Total distance for the return trip: 1,107 miles / 1,781 km

Total mileage for the entire journey (outbound and return trips): 2,194 miles / 3,530 km

This revised itinerary allows you to stay well within your 3,000-mile limit. Please note that driving times and distances are approximate and may vary depending on traffic and road conditions. Don't forget to double-check the availability of charging points and confirm their compatibility with your vehicle before embarking on your journey. Enjoy your road trip!
